html:
1.11.19  10:05 pm   1.10.19  4:12 pm , i can only presume your argument is that weezer's drums are too sharp, draw too much attention for the song.  

     actually the opposite, in this case

     toto's version has very soft percussion, quite simple and merely functional.  

     disagree. the groove and percussion is what makes that whole song tick. it's a song about africa. even starts with the perc/groove alone, just to set the tone

      of all the things to examine in toto's recording, the drums stand out the least

     disagree, what about those mega iconic drum fills before the chorus. those should practically be in the lyrics, cuz you know everyone sings those. the weezer version actually left one of those out entirely. but more importantly their groove didn't work for me. the toto version has this kick pattern which carries the song. not just because of the pattern itself but also because the kick lines up with the snare, creating a 4 on the floor feel. take that out and you just simply can't feel the pulsation of mother earth

1.11.19  9:24 pm   Just saw you in Genius, absolutely loved it. Are you kinda disappointed that you probably wanted to explain the lyrics to another song? 

     no

1.11.19  8:48 pm   how do I listen to the new song everyone's talking about?  it doesn't seem to be listed on https://billwurtz.com/songs.html

      that's true, i'm sorry about that, this is due to tensions and disarray within the company. it is on all the major music sites, such as spotify, youtube, apple, google play, etc. it's called "at the airport terminal" and if you type it into google search i'm sure you will find it

1.11.19  8:31 pm   What do you do when a project starts to feel like a slog?

     consult the emerald of original clarity (eooc)

      Write now I'm working on a pet project and I'm at a point where I have to do a lot of art and it's all very similar; it's not inspiring and it's mostly depressing because I can see how bad I am as an artist very clearly.

     you are clearly getting better. i know this for 3 reasons. one is you are doing it a lot. two is you are more keenly aware of what you don't like, so your awareness is better. and three is you are very fixated on wanting to be good, which is going to cause you to search for goodness like a gold miner in a gold mine

1.11.19  8:31 pm   Did you intend for "airport terminal" to have that nursery rhyme vibe to it?

     sure

      It feels like a song I'd have learned in primary school, but like, in a cool way

1.11.19  7:19 pm   When are you?

     any moment now

1.11.19  6:10 pm   Opinion on the tv show Frasier?

     no

1.11.19  6:06 pm   are there any fairly consistent tricks to making parts of songs stronger, or is it just intuition

      if you can counteract its weakness that is always a good bet

1.11.19  4:43 pm   What is this, until the night returns song? 

     at the airport terminal

1.11.19  4:26 pm   oh fuck, airport terminal is actually in 4 the whole time, isn't it?

     except for a bar of 2/4 here or there, the old 'country reset' at the last word of the verse

      the bridges are just super synopated not different time sigs? that's fucking wild

     sounds pretty normal to me actually

1.11.19  4:10 pm   Why are there so many songs not on your official website floating around the internet, like just did a bad thing, or at the airport terminal

     just did a bad thing is on here. airport terminal is not because it was a mistake that i released it before the video. it was not meant to be released before the video

1.11.19  4:01 pm   what's the difference between lyrical delivery in what's usually considered "rap" versus a traditional sing-songy verse, in terms of music theory? I know there are many songs that tow the line, but there's also two clear extremes, and I want to know what exactly the difference between those extremes is 

      as music makers, it is our job to simply have a great time in whatever way we can, and then the dictionaries get to try to figure out what the heck it was. sometimes the dictionaries disagree with each other, so you get shows like dictionary wars, etc

1.11.19  3:29 pm   Hey bill this is a silly question but you really love that adidas cap huh?

     not really, i just like all the other ones less

      Is there any syory behind it or is it just a darn good hat?

     it is good except i wish there were other good ones that didn't have a brand name on it so obvioiusly. i keep going to the store to find them but the only good ones have that logo on it so i just end up buying the same one instead. there was actually a white one that i thought would be good but there are 2 problems, 1 it doesn't actually look good and 2 it has the same logo. logos are fine, but if it is shown for audiences it makes me feel silly that i am doing that for free. brands pay big money for that

1.11.19  2:46 pm   What are the rules that make music sound good?

     not even the world's leading scientists have figured it out

     Like, what makes music, music?

     everything is itself

      If I throw out just some random notes like E A# F Bb and I play it it probably isn't gonna sound harmonious or pleasing. What makes a note sequence "musical"?

     if you believe in it when you do it. or even just if the person who hears it believes in it when they hear it

1.11.19  2:34 pm   I'm going through a hard time and your videos help cheer me up so much! I hope you're doing well! What do you do when you're not making music or videos? Any exciting hobbies?

     i try to incorporate all my hobbies into things i can display online. for example, i've done anagrams for a long long time but sometimes i've done them in videos and in 2017 i added a section of the site for that

1.11.19  1:22 pm   what time signature did you think of the bridges of Airport Terminal in? 

     4/4 except for "time to let" which would be one bar of 2/4

1.11.19  1:15 pm   whenever someone asks you about your favorite bill wurtz song, you say you would prefer to make a new one to be your favorite. I find this to be a very reasonable answer because it seems like every new song you put out is the best thing you've ever done. is that what you mean by making a new one to be your favorite? Or are you just too enamored by the process of making music to distract yourself with judging stuff that's already finished?

      judging a favorite of the past only seems appropriate for someone who is not capable of making more

1.11.19  1:10 pm   Is it not fustrating to record songs that you wrote in 2010 - 2013 when you record songs that you wrote last month or something?

     that's right, if i am doing the new ones then the old ones cannot frustrate me. similarly, whilst i am recording the old ones the new ones cannot frustrate me.

1.11.19  1:07 pm   Why did you change the thumbnail of this video
https://youtu.be/J2ukpvP5mL8

     in june 2014 i changed the thumbs of all my videos to custom thumbs, due to enabling custom thumbs

1.11.19  1:05 pm   1.9.19  8:22 am nice ok. no wonder so many of your songs sit very happily in my range in their original keys. but the Bbs in airport terminal are very resonant for how close they are to Ab. i think your walkin' around hum habit may be relaxing your cords even better than they already were.

      don't forget, that's layered like crazy with instruments, plus i never have to use a take that's really not good enough

1.11.19  12:47 pm   (continued from previous annoying request) for example someone has already written a userscript that makes question urls copyable

     i already have that. it auto-converts when you put it in the question box. that's how so many people are able to use them here effortlessly

      and it would be pretty easy i think for you to implement this, even with minimal programming knowledge. ultimately if you want your site to be the best vehicle for sharing your content you are going to have to bite the bullet and improve it from its simple form

     i prefer to drink bullets, but where i'm from it's considered a gift when people give away their life's work for free despite the fact that it is sold fair and square elsewhere

1.11.19  1:04 pm   Do you think your songs stand alone in acoustic form, with just guitar or piano and vocals ?

     any song can be done that way

1.11.19  1:04 pm   How important is the production of your songs (drums, synths, vocal harmonies, mixing etc) ? 

     a general rule of thumb is if you don't produce it then it won't exist

1.11.19  12:42 pm   1.9.19  4:55 pm the sheer number of songs on that page makes doing that (at least without downloading them all) quite a chore. the website could benefit from hiring a developer to implement quality of life features such as sorting songs by length instead of date

     i'm giving you all my songs for free, in the order they were made. i am sorry for any inconveniences incurred by this

1.11.19  12:33 pm   what's your latest contract say

     i can't tell you

1.11.19  11:59 am   is it bad to sleep in class

     it depends if you use a pillow

1.11.19  11:08 am   when you finish something and it's not totally how you want it, do you ever consider re-making it over and over again until it's very close to exactly what you want?

     it depends how large the project is. for example if it is a 1 line textual tweet, then maybe i would re-do it to make it right. if it's a world history video then maybe not

1.11.19  11:07 am   Do you ever feel 'overloaded' with creative inspiration for different outlets/mediums?

     yes

      How do you sort things out and decide how to advance?

     you must complete the 12 levels of suffering, then the 13th which is the unlucky last and final level; the reason it is unlucky is because after you finish it you will be informed that there is another level after that

      A lot of the time I feel like this and then do nothing as a result, or, have a manic period where I just do some random creative thing that I don't really care about much but feel like I need to get out of my head.

     sounds like you could be anywhere between levels 2 and 9

1.11.19  10:48 am   is the music video supposed to come out Jan 15th or is it going to come out this weekend?

     it was supposed to come out jan 8

1.11.19  10:33 am   I have a weird situation. About four years ago I finally stepped into making and singing music after growing up in an family that believed music making, esp singing, is the realm of an elite few talented people. I always rebelled against this idea in my heart because but didn't participate in misic making until I left that environment about 4 yrs ago. anyways, after 4 years of singing w a vocal group I could just feel that my voice, my ears, improv and other abilities had become quite strong. About 6 mo ago I leveled up again in my understanding of music and began making/recording my own music and performing more on my own time, not just with my group. So, I know my strongest suit is harmony and singing with others, but recently at a mic night I sang a song (used a mic) by myself, no accompanymnent, which is a first for me. Icould hear myself during and it I was delighted that my voice both sounded and felt good, which i have learned are some of several markers that you are making a good, strong sound. But a friend recorded it, then sent it to me later. I watched it to see what it sojnded like from an audiences persective and it actually didn't sound great, not bad but not good. There were a few notes I thought I nailed but were actually a little shaky, and overall tone was not as strong as I had felt it was in the moment. This devastates me because my body and my ears to ears told me it sounded nice while I was performing, but the actual recorded audio denies this...I feel shattered. So now I am wondering if I should just halt all my musical persuits,

     no

      if I still apparently am not a strong singer even after lots of practice over the last few years and a sense that I had grown into my own voice. I love making music more than anything, and my favorite instrument is voices because it feels so physial and raw to share music that way. but if my soundmaker is fundamentally gross than I feel the whole process is perverted from the get-go. So i'm looking for guidance from friends and musicians I trust: is there anything here that i mentioned you are familiar with and have advice for?

     i am familiar with doing something for a while and then getting to the point where you really feel like you are getting good. then doing it more and then really feeling like you are getting even better. you explained that part very clearly, and it's obviously true

      and is it a good idea to trust that wonderful sensation inside you when you are singing that tells you the sound is pleasing?

     yes, that's the only thing there is

      and thanks for fielding this long ask

     don't forget to do more live appearances, as many as you can. and if you think there is a problem with the recorded result not being as good as you thought, then keep doing that too. you can learn that just the same as you learned all the other stuff you've learned. also don't forget, ............ singing without any chordal accompaniment is probably gonna be really really strange, unless you are singing music that was absolutely not written with chords

1.11.19  10:30 am   what inspired you to create ball & stick?

     i really wanted to start doing non-song videos again. what i really want to do is do a very long non-fiction one. but those take so insanely long to make that no one would even know i was doing it. so i started trying to think of ways i could do fact-based videos on a much much shorter scale. i still couldn't think of any way to do it in 1 week. so i settled for fictional. that one was essentially written the same way as 'hi i'm steve,' 'soap tips,' etc. ... which is just make something up

1.11.19  10:27 am   what is your opinion on cargo pants?

     you could even carry another pair of pants, in your pants

1.11.19  9:50 am   >>Yo Bill why don't you release any "actual" album? Think it would be good if there's one which sums up your music career, that your fans can enjoy<<

     i prefer to release songs individually. that's the way i've always listened to music. as a listener, i've never listened to albums. but i have listened to thousands and thousands of songs. i love songs. so that's what i do. but the good news is all of them are actual

     camera drones

     yes. more if possible

     are the good things even good if they make the bad things worse

1.11.19  3:31 am   1.5.19  5:13 pm was the hidden thing in hotewig the thing that says "i have nightmares" on one of the frames during the big bang/ creation of the universe sequence?

     that's not very hidden because it occurs in a place that very obviously has hidden stuff, so everyone goes looking for it. there are many hidden things, probably some that i don't even remember

1.11.19  1:00 am   would you ever do a video or livestream of your editing process

     yes

1.10.19  11:05 pm   Why did you make the Burger King song like what was the purpose 

     that was a sort of insecurity defense mechanism. i was feeling hopeless, jobless, didn't really know how i was gonna get it together. was envious of people who had serious full time music biz careers, such as (for example) writing custom jingle songs for commercials! this is actually mostly a thing of the past, but i was fantasizing i guess. and i was hungry for burger king, but when you don't have a job you simply just can't just simply go out a spend money on burger king. so some kind of dillusional logic in my mind told me that if i could write and record a 30 second jingle for burger king, on the spot, that would at least justify going there somehow. so i did it. unfortunately the cutoff was not professional in the slightest, the damn thing ran way over, to like 34 maybe? but at least it got finished successfully, during a time when i was mostly way too confused to even exceed 5 seconds! so sure enough i did the 30+ burger king one and promptly went to actual burger king, which for the folks at home would be the one near astoria boulevard next to the N train

1.10.19  11:03 pm   okay, so, this is long but hear me out. i live in super-serious college land with super-serious computer science people and i'm stuck here until summer, and then for the next 2 years (i'm already too deep to quit now). over the last three years or so i have been too afraid of being free. i live in this bubble where i pretend to be someone i'm not, even to the point where i'll just randomly want to burst out singing in public because i know it would cheer everyone up. i'm really a music and fitness guy who didn't have the balls to just try being a freelance musician, so i just relied on college. But now, i've realized college doesn't help me learn anything and also college sucks and i hate it.So basically, i'm a 5-year-old trapped in a young adult's body. i know that once i start being myself and fully commit to it, there will be no turning back to the old way of thinking, and i'm honestly completely okay with that, except i'm naturally a more "out-there" person than most people and many people i know, (including professors) can and have seen my assertiveness and certainty as disrespect or rudeness. I've requested a solo room so i can be a weirdo and make content in there without anyone judging me, so that's at least a start i guess. Point is, i'm going to change eventually, but the question is just time. My gut is telling me to break out of this mentality now, the sooner the better. I guess the question is, in your experience, is it beneficial to your insecurity around other people to start being yourself fully around them,

     yes

      or does just being yourself in front of a camera to the internet have the same effect?

     very different. much much more calculated

      Basically i'm scared that if i just wait to become popular someday before i translate the skills to the real world, i'll just be even more hopelessly awkward when and if that time comes. i would love to just push myself to start now, but it's becoming increasingly clear that the only viable option is to ask for at least a tiny amount of validation from someone else before plunging headfirst into life-changing behavior. Any thoughts on this?

     it's quite simple, it just comes from actual experience. if you find yourself on stage regularly, you will inevitably get totally used to it and very strong there. if you find yourself around people constantly, you will very quickly get much better and stronger. a nice trick is to get a job, any kind of job, where you are around people. i think you will learn a lot about the world regardless of what kind of job it is. and just when you least expect it you will notice that you got some money somehow which you could use to buy some flashy new socks, and matching sandals

      Also how do you ask a follow-up question

      what the heck is a follow up question

     nothing but you can even the score a little by making fun of theirs

1.10.19  8:49 pm   is there any music you like that's so harmonically nuts that you don't totally understand it and haven't transcribed it?

      if i like it, then that means it gets me. regardless of how complicated it is. so if i liked it and therefore it gets me and then i learn what it is, then i am enabling it to potentially get at me through my own writing in the future, if the time is right when i may least expact

      not even the leading scientists quite know
